remarks: A surjective monoid morphism preserves identity element. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 25-Jan-2020.)
statement:
ghmgrp.f $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. X /\ y e. X ) -> ( F ` ( x .+ y ) ) = ( ( F ` x ) .+^ ( F ` y ) ) ) $.
ghmgrp.x $e |- X = ( Base ` G ) $.
ghmgrp.y $e |- Y = ( Base ` H ) $.
ghmgrp.p $e |- .+ = ( +g ` G ) $.
ghmgrp.q $e |- .+^ = ( +g ` H ) $.
ghmgrp.1 $e |- ( ph -> F : X -onto-> Y ) $.
mhmmnd.3 $e |- ( ph -> G e. Mnd ) $.
mhmid.0 $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` G ) $.
mhmid $p |- ( ph -> ( F ` .0. ) = ( 0g ` H ) ) $.
$d .+ x y $.
$d .+^ x y $.
$d .0. x y $.
$d F x y $.
$d G x y $.
$d H x y $.
$d X x y $.
$d Y x y $.
$d ph x y $.
